page.title: 10HISTORICAL BUILDINGS
page.content: {Langtons}is a Registry Office in a park. It is a big mansion and it used to belong to Mr "Varco" Williams. The mansion was built in the 18th century and was given to the Urban District Council when Mr Varco Williams died in 1929 and is still used as council offices. The grounds of Langtons were used as a cricket pitch. For over a hundred years teams have played in the park. Close to Langtons stands another old house called{Fairkytes}which was occupied for many years by a son of Elizabeth Fry, the prison reformer. The lovely old house still looks out on the lake. The lake and grounds are indeed a very pleasant feature of present day central Hornchurch.
